Reviews.Title: “Stylish decor, friendly owners and well located.”
Reviews.Author: Tanny81
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying 3 nights at this cozy and family-run hotel. Our room was beautifully decorated and very big with a lovely view to the canal. The owner was very helpful especially by climbing 2 flights of stairs (very narrow) to take our luggage to the room (there's no elevator). The hotel smelled pancakes! Unfortunately we didn't try its breakfast. Liked the hotel's location which is close to the museums and restos, the friendly service, and the selection of English-speaking tv channel options that are not available at many hotels. I was a bit bothered with the bathroom that didn't have ventilation/window therefore was a bit smelly, the bed and pillow which weren't firm enough to our liking to give us a good sleep and the lack of snacks (although they provided me a banana, there were only beverages and chocolate bars). Overall I highly recommend this boutique hotel if you're tired of staying at big hotel chains and want to stay at a more charming and friendlier place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy room, friendly service, lovely breakfast and cute cats!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraH1985
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed for two nights in April 2012 and found this hotel to be a very convenient base to explore the city. We arrived at the hotel a couple of hours before we were due to check-in but the lady who runs the place was only to happy to let us leave our suitcases behind reception whilst we went out for a bite to eat, she also did the same for us when we came to check-out and had a bit of a wait before our flight. The room we stayed in was on the ground floor and was a good size with a toilet room and a shower wet-room. The room was clean and tidy, with a neutral decor, there was a tv, wi-fi and computer facilities just outside. There was a bit of noise from outside on the first night (a saturday), with police sirens and people walking past the window, but nothing too bad and to be expected really when staying in a city. All in all though it was generally quiet on the other night. The lady who runs the place was very helpful and chatty. The breakfast we had on the sunday was excellent, set us up for the day. They have a really cute dog and cats who just wander about, which we thought was lovely as we are animal lovers and it gives the place a homey atmosphere. If I was to come back to Amsterdam I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and in town”
Reviews.Author: S F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my birthday weekend and found the place very nice indeed, the owner and the personnel were very friendly, gave us tips for restaurants and we felt welcome. The room, that we got as an upgrade, was very stylish and spacious. We liked the cosy soft beds very much and the fact that the modern bathroom had even a tub came in handy, as winter had returned to Amsterdam. the view was also lovely, and the fact that the hotel was only a short walk from the centre with bars, shops etc was really cool. we just took the tramway because we were so tired at the end of the day from walking allover, otherwise you could easily walk home. the breakfast was very nice indeed, ample choice and the freshly made omelette really good! The only downpoint really were the draughty windows, perhaps due to the building being an original old town house, we had to put a towel at the bottom of the balcony door to keep the draught out. Though when I mentioned this in the hotel's own review, the owner took it up and emailed me that she would install rubber insulation, as suggested. I found that very positive! All in all, we would recommend this hotel very warmly.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Amanda W
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, perfectly situated close to the centre but tucked away from the noise. A beautiful hotel with lots of character, friendly staff, lovely clean rooms, and excellent breakfasts! The pancakes are recommended, they set you up for the day! Whats more, they have a lovely small dog and two wonderful kittens which we were allowed to play with. Cant wait to book another trip to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Little Jewel of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Randi M
Reviews.Content: The Boutique Hotel View is a lovely little place overlooking a canal just far enough away from the hub-bub of the square, and close enough to be a short walk away from everything you want in Amsterdam. The place is clean, warm, friendly and they make you a wonderful Dutch breakfast with the best pancake I have ever had! (One will last you through most of the day.) They have two adorable house kitties who guard the stairs and a house doggie named Snowy. Don't be surprised if you get a visit from one of the kitties who will come into your room, stay a while to be petted and look through your things, and then politely go to the door and wait to be let out. Beds were incredibly comfortable and the atmosphere was homey and friendly. Wouldn't think twice about where we stay next time we are lucky enough to venture to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique - friendly service and CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: AAfemaletravellerAUS
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in February. This was the first stop of our 3week trip and we weren't disappointed. I did a lot of research in booking our accommodation and reading the reviews of this place I had high expectations. We met Natalie when we arrived she was really friendly and accommodating. I did warn my partner that I booked the top floor and their would be lots of steps and being Amsterdam the we're narrow and steep. It might seem daughting but at the boutique they were only to happy to help us lifting out luggage. It was amazing how Natalie seemed to lift our luggage above her head with ease(although she did tell us she was a roadie for many years). So as long as you ok walking up and down stair their shouldn't be an issue. I booked a small deluxe room so was wasn't expecting anything big. And I have to say I was pleasantly surprised the room was big enough to fit two full sized suit cases and carry on bags. It had basic facilities but there was no mini bar. But if you did need a drink they were available 24/7 at reception. I must say the room was very clean and photos on their website actually represent want your getting. If your staying here I would recommend taking the bus. There is bus you can catch about 200m from the hotel that takes you directly to and from the airport and it only cost around 6â‚¬. We took a taxi to the hotel and without traffic we paid 55â‚¬.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Smallks73
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a weekend with my wife and what a treat it was to spend it here. The owner could not have done more for us, the room (103) was perfect, big, recently refurbished with a nice bay window overlooking the canal. Breakfast was as much good basic food as you liked, all cooked to order. location - we loved it! Ten minutes from Dam square on trams 1/2/5 which are never more than a 5 minute wait. Also the local square is lively but only 2 mins walk. All close, but not too close. We slept like babies in absolute peace and quiet. If this place is on your short list - just book it!

Reviews.Title: “BOUTIQUE VIEW”
Reviews.Author: MOSIE40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this little gem of a hotel for 3 nights. Natalie was so welcoming and friendly as was her brother who cooked us eggs for breakfast every morning, and was so helpful! i would highly recommend this hotel to anyone great location, trendy, clean ,good breakfast, lots of nice places to eat just round the corner. The only down side would be that two of our group were on the top floor and collapsed on the bed exhausted when they got there, but it did make us laugh. The staff carried our bags to our rooms as the stairs are quite an effort, but so worth it. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “now know exactly why the hotel consistently scores 5/5!”
Reviews.Author: PK85
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights with my girlfriend in february. i've always stayed in the leidseplein area as it is in my opinion the best spot, so the hotel's location was always going to be ideal. and so to the hotel.. stayed in a small canal view bedroom. the room was excellent and all that i could ask for. bed very comfy, room clean and in very good condition. quite simply perfect. the staff were, as everyone has previously said, great. The breakfasts were delicious - a freshly cooked pancake or omelette along with a variety of items from the breakfast buffet. i dont think i can add anything new to what others have said, other than that it really is a superb hotel. we booked this based on tripadvisor reviews but still said to ourselves 'lets not get too confident its as great as others have said', but it sure didnt disappoint. my girlfriend and i were so happy with our stay, and i'd go as far as to say that staying once again at the boutique hotel view could well be the number one reason we'd come back to amsterdam .. which is a certainty. 110% see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Shreen_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Boutique Hotel View for 4 nights in early February. It's a cosy little hotel which to me is more like a home than a hotel. Our room was on the third floor and yes, getting up those 3 flights of stairs was indeed a challenge (no hotel lift) especially after a night out. Did I mention how very narrow and steep those stairs are? In any case we had a laugh each time climbing up and down holding on to the railing for dear life. Don't worry about carrying your suitcases/bags up/down. There will be someone there to do it for you each time. Once we'd opened the door to our Deluxe Room there was more than enough space to relax and unwind (we didn't trip over our suitcases once!). The window-with-canal-view was not quite what we expected - the view was beautiful but the window was smalli-ish (read: tiny) - you'd have to contort your body like an acrobat to peer your head out (the other rooms had much bigger windows). Nevertheless, it was a wonderful view. Hotel's location is excellent - 2 mins by foot to Leidseplein and walking distance to many restaurants, cafe's, bistros, shopping, etc. Easy access to tram/buses, less than 10 mins away to Central Station. The room/amenities were basic but clean and tastefully decorated. The beds - one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept on. Nice finishings. Nathalie, our hotel manager/front desk manager/chef was fantastic. She's warm, kind, witty, helpful and very very strong (she carried our luggage over her head up and down those stairs like it was nothing). Nathalie also makes the best pancakes for breakfast and really went out of her way to help us with directions, tips and flight inquiries (our flights were delayed/cancelled). Nathalie was even quick to tell us that there was a Dutch celebrity staying at the hotel; after showing us his picture on the internet, we tried to organise a stakeout but to no avail. The rest of the staff were also welcoming and helpful - this includes two cats and a dog named "Kutty". I'm not a big fan of cats especially neurotic ones but these two were friendly, warm, gentle and contemplative (they would sit by the window and stare into space lost in their idle reverie) Kutty is nothing but adorable. The three just added to the character of the hotel. All in all, a really nice experience staying at Boutique Hotel View. I recommend it for those seeking a reasonably priced hotel close to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MarieKehoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and as mentioned in other reviews the staff are great. The rooms are fairly basic and the stairs are very steep. If you book a double bed, you get two singles pushed together. Its not cheap but having said that it is a good choice for a week-end break. The lounge/breakfast area is really nice and the cats and dog add to the ambience in my opinion. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel View lives up to reviews”
Reviews.Author: HullEmily
Reviews.Content: We received a warm welcome when we arrived tired from travelling from Hull. The hotel is round the corner from the Leidseplein tram stop. The room was warm, clean and comfortable with twin and sofa beds. Our family room did overlook back gardens rather than the canal but we werent even there in daylight really so it didnt matter too much. All the hotel staff were very helpful in pinpointing places on the map to visit. It had a real family feel with two friendly pet kittens that my daughters loved. We packed so much in to the two days thanks to advice and good map supplied - including Anne Frank House, Madame Tussauds, canal cruise, Van Gogh museum and the handbag museum, flower market, shopping and more Tips: get to the Anne Frank House 20 mins before opening to avoid queuing for too long and get someone to get coffee and croissants from the Cup cake bakery round the corner to enjoy while you wait. For a really nice evening meal that is good value and suits both vegetarian and meat eaters in your party try Kantjil and de Tijger on Spuistraat. Delicious Indonesian food. Emma

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Staff, Rooms, Price”
Reviews.Author: JenGP
Reviews.Content: I made a 24 hour solo side trip to Amsterdam on the way to Dubai from a business trip to Lithuania in January. The decision to go was random so I relied on Tripadvisor reviews on which hotel to take. I was only spending 24 hours in Amsterdam so I needed an affordable hotel in a central location so I don't waste time traveling, and at the same safe for a solo female traveler. And boy, I was beyond happy with the decision. Location - easy to find, located on the same block as some good restaurants, cafes and theaters. Less than 2 minute walk and you'll find a tourist information center. It's right next to a beautiful canal that you can view from some of the rooms. 3 minute walk to tram station and Leidseplein (for some nightlife and a variety of restaurants from fine dining to fast food) Rooms - most rooms are overlooking the canal. Their cheaper rooms are tiny, just enough for a double bed, a cabinet, and some room to walk around and place your luggage, but this is expected of hotel rooms in Europe. I got a chance to peek at the bigger rooms and they were surprisingly spacious. My tiny room (around 130Eur) was clean and the bed very comfortable. The windows were adorned with 2 layers of curtains - a sheer one and a thick one to block out the sun. Flat screen TV on the wall showed only 2 english channels but I didn't really care since I was out the whole day anyway. Bathroom - small but clean and adequate. Adequate supply of towels and toiletries. Shower was big enough to move freely, not cramped. Hair dryer available. Service - it's the best thing about this hotel. Check in time was I think 1pm but I was there before 11am, so I asked if I could just leave my bags and walk around the area first to kill time. Nathalie, who greeted me like a long lost sister, told me not to worry, my room is ready! She even wanted to upgrade me to a much bigger and way more expensive room (after she saw my huge luggage), however that room was 2 floors higher than my cheaper room so I had to decline the wonderful gift explaining that I'm a couch potato who never exercises and hates stairs (esp after a tiring day of exploring the place). After hearing that Nathalie took my luggage and carried it to my room! She and other Staff helped me with suggestions on where to go, how to get there, which trams to take, approximate price of tours, etc. They booked my taxi for me, and Nathalie served the taxi driver coffee while I was busy getting my stuff ready. She even went up to carry my luggage again! Breakfast - located in the dining/reception area. The place was cozy and the breakfast was good and fresh. There wasn't much variety but there's enough choices, food was delicious, and the housekeeper cooked nonstop at the end of the room (which gave the place a very homey feel) and kept offering additional food that she's cooking. The only negative thing about the hotel is the very steep stairs, which is forgivable. Also just be warned that there are resident cats in the hotel who freely walk around the place. They're adorable and well behaved, but is noteworthy in case you're allergic to cats.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Valentines”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia P
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the wonderful reviews on trip adviser we had a chance to stay at this wonderful hotel. While the weather in Amsterdam wasn't the best, we had received the warmest welcome by the hotel staff. Everyone was friendly and welcoming. The service was well above anyone can expect, even in a five star hotel. They had really gone far to make our Valentine's special. The location of the hotel was incredible, 5 minutes from where the bus stops from the airport, 5 minutes to the all the shops, bars, restaurants. The stairs are as steep as in any typical Amsterdam hotel, however as long as you don't have a problem with a bit of exercise, it is the perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location, with delicious, homemade breakfast prepared by a friendly and accommodating staff. It's literally around the corner from all the theaters, music halls, and nightlife of the Leidseplein, and only a 10 minute walk to the Museumplein, or really anywhere else you want to go in central Amsterdam. The only possible negative I can think of is that the stairway is pretty steep, but that's what you get in canal houses. After breakfast the first morning of our trip I knew that I had made the right hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “If you get chance, STAY AT THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: 79Alison
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel after reading the excellant reviews on Trip advisor - we were not disappointed. We flew into Amsterdam on the early flight forgetting that check in was not until 2pm, however this was not a problem for the lovely hotel staff at the Boutique hotel. Having found the hotel we were tired and very cold (as the weather was below zero) Nathalie friendly as ever welcomed us with a hot chocolate on the house and explained that we couldn't get into our room just yet as they were being cleaned but immediately upgraded our room (from a small double) to a room overlooking the canal and arranged for it to be next on the list to be cleaned- All free of charge! We happily waited in the dining area which was a lovely comfy, cosy room overlooking Amsterdam, drinking our yummy hot chocolates and petting the hotel dog! The hotel itself was clean, stylish and spacious. The rooms were decorated beautifully and had everything you needed - shampoo, shower gel and a tv with many channels. We had a small room but this was ample space for us (a couple) and instantly felt like home. Every morning we would awake to the smell of fresh baking in the kitchen - Things dont get much better than this! After hearing the rave reviews on the hotel pancakes and omlettes we had already decided to have breakfast here each morning and for 10 euros it was fantastic value. On offer there were self service cheese, meats, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, fresh croissants and breads and the offer of something freshly cooked. Nathalie was on the day shift so was not there to make our pancakes but her brother (again a lovely friendly guy) was- and let me tell you these pancakes were DELICIOUS! In fact the breakfasts were SO good they alone were enough to secure us a return visit hopefully in June. I have never been to a hotel so intent on making you feel welcome and I am not talking about overly selling places, trips etc or being bombarded with suggestions or opinions- you are treated just as one of the family, if you want to sit and chill- this is fine.. if you want to have a beer and chat..this is fine, in fact we never at any time felt at all awkward- it was like visiting friends we had not met before. Even the hotel dog and 2 kittens were so lovely adding that home from home feel to the place - I have never met such well behaved pets either I might add. We are already planning to come back later in the year to 'show off' this little gem of a hotel to all of our friends (and we only arrived back in Manchester today) The central location of this hotel was perfect and we walked everywhere easily - so many lovely places to eat or just have a beer and watch the world go by. Again Thank you for a lovely stay at the Boutique view, and readers get booking as this hotel soon will be an Amsterdam hotspot!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly and fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Frankers1982
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam with four friends. We had two rooms, one triple (twin beds and sofabed) and one twin. The rooms are very spacious, high ceilings and large windows so very light and airy. Ours had a lovely view over the snowy canal. Good sized en suite with bath/shower and nice toiletries provided. My only thought was there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, however there is a machine in the bar from which you can take a drink to your room. My friend asked for hot water and was then offered a kettle for the room. The staff are simply fantastic, cannot help you enough giving us advice on best places to go, which trams or buses to use and sorting out taxis for us. Although the hotel is not right in the centre, we found we could get to all the sights we wanted to see within a twenty five minute walk (in the snow) and there is the excellent public transport system with stops a couple of minutes from the front door. A fantastic weekend had by all and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back next year.”
Reviews.Author: Dobby
Reviews.Content: For the last 11 years I've been travelling to Amsterdam for a major trade show and a few days extra holiday. Each year I've stayed in a different hotel hoping to find one that I can keep returning to. This year I think I've hit the jackpot! Perfect location just off Leidseplein with all its bars, restaurants, theatres and other nightlife. Walking distance to the museum district and easy access via tram to the city centre or out to the RAI. The hotel itself is a classic canal-side townhouse and we had a loft room with views over the canal. The stairs were a bit of a trial (especially after a night out) but you'll get this in a lot of Amsterdam hotels that have been converted from houses. The rooms are all tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. We didn't have the breakfast on this visit but at â‚¬10 it compares favourably with eateries in the area. A word of warning for anyone with cat or dog allergies, there are two resident cats and a small dog. I thought they added to the ambience but they might not be everyone's cup of tea. If you find yourself here on a Wednesday night, you really should head down to the Alto Jazz Cafe to see Hans Dulfer's band. Awesome night out but get there early if you want a seat.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel very welcome, fab location close to tourist hotspots and also the 'real' Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Bev4971
Reviews.Content: As an authentic Dutch canal-side house, this is a fabulous find in close proximity to everything a short-medium stay traveler could want. Once you've mastered the public transport network, you'll realise that all accessibility options are available just a 3 minute walk away. Eateries and coffee shops are plentiful closeby, including a local jazz club where the famous Hans Dulfer is the resident entertainer as entertainment dessert. Tourist hotspots such as the Ann Frank house, Madame Tussauds, Van Gogh museum, the Heineken experience and the Rijksmuseum are either walkable or just a short tram journey from the hotel. Whilst the more popular hotspots are accessible, it's also easy to venture into the 'real' Amsterdam living/working areas either on foot or by bus/tram too and sample non-touristy architecture and everyday life. The rooms are spotlessly clean and I don't say that lightly! Must admit, I do go a hunting for faults, but I couldn't find any at all with any aspect of the cleanliness. The lobby however is home to the two affectionate resident cats who are adorable but maybe not everyone's cup of tea. The owner of the hotel works the front desk some days and can't do enough for her guests - whether that be offering advice on local shopping, directions or gigs etc. A very lovely lady :o) I guess the only issue we had was the stairs - they are really steep and winding (as in all canal houses) and as I'd had recent knee-replacement surgery this proved difficult to negotiate which we hadn't really contemplated prior to arriving. In all fairness to the manager, she did offer to swap us rooms the following day to the ground floor of her neighbouring property but we loved the loftspace we'd already been given so climbed carefully and stayed where we were for 4 nights. Unless you're willing to spend the big bucks in the American Hotel up the road, I'd be really surprised if there's another hotel in such a splendid location that can offer lift access, so plan ahead. We didn't eat in the hotel but I did see the breakfast food platter and it looked fabulous! We thought that at 10E it was a tad expensive but when compared to the other eateries in the locality its a fair and comparable price and had a really good selection too, with a wide range of eating times to suit. Free wifi was a nice touch as so many places charge these days, as were the complementary coffee's in the lobby. Overall, definately a place we'd go back to, with breakfast booked next time and perhaps a call ahead to get a room on a lower floor. Thanks for a lovely stay xx

Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond... in a hotel that is already a great value”
Reviews.Author: artinads
Reviews.Content: My husband, 22-month daughter, and I arrived to Hotel Boutique View (HBV) at about 10:30am on a Sunday in mid-December for a one-night stay directly off of a (very) long flight from Seattle. My daughter had a cold, we were exhausted, the weather was quite chilly and blustery, and we were badly in need of a nap. We knew check-in wasn't until 2pm, but went straight to the hotel anyway, knowing we could at least leave our luggage. Nathalie welcomed us, offered us tea/ coffee, and checked on our room, which wasn't ready. Upon hearing our story, she took us to her home a few doors away, where she operates a B&B and let us use an empty room. We tried to keep our usage light, but we did sleep in the bed and use the restrooms. I badly wanted to give Nathalie payment for her kindness (at least knowing the room would need light housekeeping again), but she refused. We will never forget Nathalie or HBV for this reason alone, but then on top of that, the room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. And breakfast the next morning (extra charge) was delicious-- quick, hot & fresh, cooked to order with as many helpings as requested! Nathalie is an amazing cook :) Eating in the hotel was perfect for us ( although pre-kid I would've likely used breakfast as an opportunity to explore the city, Lonely Planet guidebook in hand!), as we could let our jet-lagged toddler sleep in while we took turns going downstairs for breakfast. The hotel is only a block from Leidseplein Square and we paid roughly $200/night, so I feel the value (having done a little bit of research in my hotel search) was tremendous! Amsterdan was our bridge between Seattle and Geneva and then again from Geneva to the Middle East, so we had two 1-night stays planned four days apart. The second time, we knew exactly the hospitality and graciousness that awaited us. Given the weather was cold, and our daughter was having too much fun playing with the hotel cat, we spent a lot of time in the hotel's dining area during our two stays. So we got to meet Nathalie's mother, brother, and his girlfriend- this really is a family affair! We heard life stories, our daughter was doted over, and it felt like we were staying with OUR family! Hotel BV is our only choice in Amsterdam from here forward. We won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Morrisandhemi
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Boutique view for 4 great nights. Very nice accommodations, very clean and light. A very friendly place and a great base from which to explore Amsterdam. Our room had a nice view of the canal. Only 10 mins walk to van gogh museum, 15 to the Heineken experience, 20 minutes walk to the red light district , heaps of nice cafes and restaurants within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. 2 sweet little kittens, 1 well behaved little dog. Very comfortable stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer H
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for one night on our layover to the USA. Great hotel and the owner is very friendly. The beds were comfy and its in a great location. We walked to a popular bar LUX and there are so many stores around

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Megan T
Reviews.Content: Went here for a quiet trip away for my birthday, I cannot name a fault with the hotel, they were absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat homely...”
Reviews.Author: Courtneybyfield
Reviews.Content: this hotel was possibly the best service from a hotel me and my partner have received. We have travelled for over 1.5 months so far and it was a relief to arrive into a hotel and feel somewhat at home... Natalie was very down to earth, and accommodating to our day to day requests, and we even decided to stay an extra day which we advised her on the day of check-out and she was very helpful. We had the small room, but it was fine for 3 days, the rooms are very modern and clean. Location was great, close to trams and taxi rank is not far away at all. It is 2 minute walk to the entertainment square where there are pubs, clubs and restaurants. Definitely a 10/10 hotel, we are already recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Alexramsay
Reviews.Content: A real pleasure to stay in. Very comfortable, quiet and well located. The owner Natalie was kindness itself, friendly and helpful. At her suggestion we were upgraded at no charge to a larger room. Only a 2-star hotel, but very much better than some 4-stars I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel! I have fallen in love with this place!”
Reviews.Author: Denis756
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable place. Just 2 steps from night club Melkweg. Good starting point to walk around Amsterdam center. The manager Nataly is very kind and help us with everything. Spend a wonderful New Year! Big thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome place to stay and great owners”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: I have to say this was my 7th hotel in 2 weeks in Europe and one of my best stays. The location is great 3 min walk to the trams/ buses its about 6 stops from the Red light very quiet location you don't hear any traffic noise. The owners were the best very friendly and very helpful with sightseeing directions and map. They emailed me great instructions for different ways to get there from the airport. We took the bus it was a 20 min ride and only 6 euros each. She even carried my 50 pound bag up 2 flights of stairs and man the stairs are steep. The Twin room had a canal view with a balcony high ceilings nice bathroom and internet. Beds were comfortable to sleep on. Breakfast was included and her pancakes were sooo good and I don't normally eat pancakes. I would with out a doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, with a couple of disappointments...”
Reviews.Author: abby w
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself and the lady manager were lovely. It's in a great position, round the corner from a bustling square, but quiet enough in it's position to get a good nights sleep. You can walk everywhere, no need to get trams if you don't want to. My disappointment arose due to the fact that we did not receive the room we had paid for. I had booked this weekend as a birthday surprise for my partner, it was also made more special as it was our last weekend together before he had to go away for 6 months to work. I had booked a deluxe double with canal view, the money for this was taken before we arrived, however on arrival we only received a small double with canal view. Whilst the room we received was fine, and really rather nice for a "small double", it is not what we had paid for. We arrived on a Friday night and only stayed until the Sunday. We rushed in on friday night, did not pay much attention to the room and left again to have dinner/drinks, on the Saturday we went out to sight see. Whilst we were out on the Saturday, I checked the website to ensure that I was correct in the fact that we hadn't received the correct room and on our return to the hotel we brought this up with the guy on the desk. He unfortunately did not deal with our complaint very well and made it seem like we were to blame for not realising sooner. The matter was eventually resolved the following morning (Sunday) we did not get the room we had wanted, but did get a refund on the price we had paid. Whilst this was fine, it would have been nice to get what we had paid for in the first instance. I could understand the mix up if we had booked through a third party, however we booked through the hotel's own website and therefore I really do feel there was no excuse to be given the wrong room. It did feel in a way that the guy that directed us to the room in the first place was attempting to take advantage of us because we were a younger couple. You might think I would not return, this is not the case, as I stated before, the hotel itself was lovely, and in a great position. Although I might have a bit of anxiety about booking again, I would, I'd just be sure to confirm my booking prior to my arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Hungarian couple's review - JUST GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: zsuzsaf
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a romantic Amsterdam weekend spent at Boutique Hotel with my lover. This family owned hotel really made our weekend. Natalie, the oldest sister was just managing this hotel in such a nice personal style. When I arrived, the the mother was just making their own dinner, and since I had to wait for my boyfriend to arrive yet, and felt kind of lonely, they immediately invited me to join them. Our room was just perfect. Nice, spacious, warm and lovely. Got all the help when asking for something. Also the hotel was just a waling distance of everything. Not more than 10 minutes. I definitely recommend this hotel, and I loved to be back really soon to both this hotel and this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Steve F
Reviews.Content: The location of this converted canal house is excellent: one block off the leidseplein (at the southern end of the central canal ring). The location makes it possible to walk to almost all the places we wanted to visit. Amsterdam is a walking city but you have to be careful of all the bicycles! The staff is excellent, both in their operation of the hotel and their treatment of their guests. Natalie, the owner-manager, couldn't have been more helpful. We booked a small double room and she informed us that the small room would be too small for us so she upgraded us to a much larger room without our asking and for no additional cost. Suggestions as to restaurants, etc. were always terrific, as were general conversations during breakfasts (optional but great Dutch pancakes). The room was more than large enough to handle the two of us and a lot of luggage (which Natalie carried up to the third floor as there is no elevator). The view from the room was the intersection of two canals and was quite pleasant. My wife and I both felt we would like to visit this great city again in a few years and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahAd
Reviews.Content: Natalies friendly welcome and fantastic breakfasts made it a w/e to remember. Great location. Very clean and beds really comfortable. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Central, friendly, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Jeean P
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very attractive, attention to detail. Cannot find any fault.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star home !”
Reviews.Author: Arayman22
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. I admire the location (close to leidseplein), cleanliness, safety and comfort. Its more like a tastefully furnished home than a hotel. I felt very safe from the day one. The reason for the excellence is the hotel is personally managed by owners, Nathalie and her brother Udo. They both were very helpful and cooperative. I feel its nice place to stay if you want personalized service along with safety and comfort Further, see that the room size are as per available in all hotel in Amsterdam. One should be prepared when one is travelling in Europe, but they were very clean with all things functioning well. Further, I got exactly same room (canal view room) which was shown in the picture. No last minute surprises.The hotel is situated in a quiet location, the bed was very comfortable, so you can expect a sound sleep and room cleaning was done timely everyday. I stayed in room no. 104 (canal facing) and there the wifi was working awesome. It was my first visit to Amsterdam but I got all the essential information which is must required for tourist, thanks to Nathalie and Udo. The night shift manager were also very helpful. I think his name was Benny, he was very thoughtful and allowed me very early check in, around 8 am, understanding that I was very tired from long flight, although there check in time was 2 pm. On the whole, I really liked this hotel and would stay here again on my forthcoming visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Quick Visit”
Reviews.Author: Will Work for Plane Tickets
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for a night. We had a small triple room, it was tight for 3 people. It is a great place is you need a quiet sleeping environment (no train-tram-bus noise). The hallway is loud in the morning though, but other than that the room was very nice. I just think for the price (180 for a triple without breakfast), you can do better location-wise and quality-wise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Cosy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PedroVasconcelos
Reviews.Content: Near one of the best and central places in Amsterdam (Leidseplein). Thanks for the warm welcome, sympathy and the great cheese and bacon breakfast pancakes. :-) Very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corinne V
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in this lovely hotel near Leidseplein. Nathalie the owner and her brother are very helpful and friendly, the rooms are modern and the breakfast is delicious. We will come again dear Nathalie! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, fab-u-lous people”
Reviews.Author: Bremnosey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is eveything I would look for in a city centre hotel: a stone's throw from many of the major sites and restaurants/nightlife, without being noisy, spacious rooms and very tastefully decorated. But the reason for rating this hotel so highly is the people. The owners could not have been more welcoming, helpful and knowledgeable. And the breakfast pancakes are THE BEST. The cute cats and dog made for a home-from-home and I would thoroughly recommend BHV.

Reviews.Title: “nice people, unique place”
Reviews.Author: Entropalpy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at around the river. it is really a good place for city view, shopping and food. and the people there were also very nice. Although there was no a lift in the hotel, the people helped us to take our luggage upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Book it if you can.”
Reviews.Author: Brenda S
Reviews.Content: I don't go to a city for its hotel - but everything about this hotel makes me want to return. The owner Nathalie couldn't have been kinder or more helpful. The whole hotel has been newly renovated and everything is chic and clean. The breakfast room is superb and overlooks the canal. The dutch pancakes that Nathalie cooked up were wonderful and she does everything she can to make your stay pleasurable. She loves her life's work - running a hotel - and you can see it in everything that this hotel has to offer. The location is great - if there is a room available don't hesitate to book it.

Reviews.Title: “Marcos Pinheiro & Elvira”
Reviews.Author: Marcos P
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Boutique Hotel View, The localion and the nice staff are the great points At next time, we wil return there.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were after. Great location, friendly service and a comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: Lisaspoland
Reviews.Content: Very friendly welcome, small triple room (two singles and a double sofa bed) but you don't go to Amsterdam to party in your room. A bit of a mountain to 3rd floor, but room was clean and beds very nice. Great location and lovely breakfast. Nice welcoming feel, would stay again. For the money I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: PamMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Boutique Hotel View. The quiet canal location was perfect for walking to sights and restaurants,and was close to a tram stop as well. We had room 304 on the top floor which was a hike up steep stairs, but we do not mind stairs. We had a small room with a canal view through an iron grate. The bath was small, but had a decent shower. The room, although small had what we needed, reading lights, a room safe, a phone, a TV, desk and double bed with no line in the middle of the mattress. The linens were fine, though the towels were thin. The staff was very helpful, and the breakfasts were definitely worth 10 euros. In addition to cereals, breads, fruit, yogurt, cheese and ham, made to order omelets were offered, as well as the most delicious cheese filled pancakes. Upon the suggestion of the staff, we took bus 197 to Schipohl from a stop only one block away, and it was a bargain at 4 euros. This hotel was our refuge in busy Amsterdam, and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: Victoria L
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a stay in this hotel. Upon our arrival we were asked if we would stay in the owners home (a couple of doors down) as it was not possible for us to have the two tripples that we had booked. Our party did not want to be split up and declined the offer. Instead we were issued with a double room (which I would describe as a small single) and a basement tripple room. The room in the basement should not be offered to guests. It was dark, dingey and there was a smell of mould. The toilet and shower area was gubby and by the time the (ripped) sofa bed had been pulled out there was little space left in the room. When we asked if we could be moved, we were told that this was not possible until the next day. When we were moved (which meant re-packing all our stuff) it was to a much more comfortable room, and the owner told us that she would 'sort us out a deal'. When we came to check out we were charged even more for the experience than we would have been should we have had our original 2 tripple rooms. The lady blamed the fact that one of our party had dropped out. This was no issue to us as we had wanted to retain the 2 tripples anyway and if the other member of the party had turned up there would have been no room for her in the hotel!! Overall we were dissapointed at the way we were treated, the basement room should not be used to house guests and the fact that we ended up having to pay more for it than originally agreed soured the experience even more. On the plus side, the beds were comfortable and the reception area is clean (although there are a couple of cats and a dog housed in the hotel). The loaction of the hotel is also excellent. I would not describe this hotel as a 'boutique' hotel, more an average guest house.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: lthearts
Reviews.Content: Natalie is the highlight. A great cook, friendly helpful service and willing to go out of her way to help. We felt taken care of, safe, well located, comfortable and would definitely come back and recommend this cute hotel to everyone. Our request for a kettle was immediately addressed as was our need for a printer and a space for an adolescent visitor. They also gave great recommendations for meals, sights and routes. I have never had this service in a large 4 or 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: FargoSnowbird
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in Amsterdam for a week while I went to a medical conference. I wanted to stay in a location where my daughter could go to the museums while I was at my meeting. I couldn't have selected a better location. We were one block from the leidesplein, so plenty of restaurants, bars, shops, and dance clubs. We were on the tram line which made city travel easy. The hotel is clean and contemporary. Located on one of the canals, this picturesque hotel is a delight. Natalie, the owner, adeptly manages the reception desk AND makes breakfast. She is a wealth of information on the local spots and made our stay a lot of fun. We would definitely stay there if we visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location culturally, lovely room and, as a lonectraveller, so well looked after by the staff, it would be my first cho”
Reviews.Author: AuralGloria
Reviews.Content: I was on a budget (problems with credit cards abroad), and Natalie really helped me with deciding where I should visit. As a lone traveller, the staff made me feel so at home. Mylarge room Overlooked the canal in what I consider the best district. Free Wifi (a godsend) and fared so much better than the 5 star hotel I was booked into for the remainder of my stay. Great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Scorryb
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay in this lovely hotel off the Leidse Plein. Great central location means it's easy to walk everywhere, but trams stop just around the corner. The 197 bus from Schiphol saves on the taxi fare too! We - a family of two adults and 16 year old- stayed in a 3 person room with twin beds and a comfortable fold down sofa bed. The room was spacious and clean, and the ensuite, although very compact, was fine for our needs with shampoos and shower gels provided. The owner Natalie has a warm and humorous personality and thrives on multi-tasking- she can make apple pancakes, eggs and bacon, set tables, answer the phone and still manage to chat to her guests all at the same time! Breakfasts are highly recommended, great value, and set us up for days of exploring the city by foot and bike. We loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best small hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: KayDenmark
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Boutique Hotel View, which manages to be centrally located but still removed from Amsterdam's tourist hoardes. We had the Princess Room, with a small balcony overlooking the canal. Owner Nathalie did everything she could to make us comfortable, including carrying our luggage up three flights of stairs and whipping up great homemade pancakes in the morning. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Igor from Moscow”
Reviews.Author: Igor O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice little hotel with a very good location.We have a very good room with the beautiful channel view, wich was clean and lovely.The host Natalie was very helpful,and she help us with everything we need.She make an exellent breakfast every morniing herself and was always very friendly and kind to her gests. We liked our staing in this hostel in Amsterdam very much.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Spacious Rooms, Fabulous Owner”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from 3 weeks in Europe and we couldn't have picked a better hotel to end our trip. Natalie is a tremendous owner/host and could not have been more helpful. From making a great breakfast; to securing our cab; to making me some tea when I was feeling a little under the weather....it all came with a sincere smile and a reminder to feel free to call her if we needed anything else. The room we had was very spacious and newly renovated (we had a great canal view). The hotel is extremely well located to the Leidesplein as well as the major museums. We have traveled extensively throughout Europe and guarantee you will be delighted with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, comfy and great location!”
Reviews.Author: sarah_williams_89
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a lovely little hotel in a great location. We expected to have to get the tram alot but we didn't use it once and saved so much money being able to walk everywhere! We booked a small double room which I have read a lot of reviews saying their too small but I disagree, it was really cosy and fine for a few days stay! The breakfast is extra but is nice and you can pretty much have anything you like. We tend to only eat cereal for breakfast so Nathalie only charged us for one day which was very kind! Would definitely stay here again and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel find in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: food9521
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 3 week European trip that ended up in Amsterdam for the last 3 days. This hotel was a great find. Natalie was a great host, helping us with anything we needed and making a great breakfast each morning. The rooms are clean and kept up well. the location is excellent, right down from the main square where all the cafes and bars can be found, as well as the short distance to the museums and other sites. My wife and I highly recommend this hotel and we will return there on our next trip. Fred & Kim

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: kathythevet
Reviews.Content: My "girls" travel group went to Amsterdam this year. Based on Trip Advisor recommendations, we decided to stay at Boutique Hotel View. What a wonderful place. The location is excellent--located on a beautiful canal but walk 2 short blocks and you are in the middle of rocking Leidsplein and only a 5-10 minute walks to the Museumplein and Vondelpark. There is a bus that goes directly from the airport to this square, which we found out about for our return flight. 5 different tram lines are available in Leidsplein, although we walked everywhere in the city after we got our bearings. The canal house in which the hotel is located is charming. Natalie, the owner, is amazing. She flips fluently from English to Dutch to German (I'm sure she speaks other languages as well) and deftly cooks you a lovely breakfast to order while she sees to the front desk. At first I was a little disappointed that I got my coffee (and tea, Cappuccino, hot chocolate, etc.) from a machine but it really grew on me and I ended up really liking the Cappuccino. It uses fresh milk and good quality coffee. Obviously a state of the art single cup maker. Our room was a triple, which was snug for 3 women (one of us slept on the pullout couch) but clean and comfortable. The bathroom is tiny--be prepared for the shower to be stall-less. In other words, you pull a shower curtain across half of the tiny bathroom and take your shower just standing in front of the toilet, there is a drain in the floor. Worked fine, just a little strange to adjust to, since we are used to shower stalls or tubs. I have encountered this before in Europe. The room was a little dark, but we spent so little time in it, no big deal. I would stay in this hotel again in a heartbeat--it was very inexpensive and a fabulous find. Thank you Natalie and thank you Trip Advisor for steering us to this little jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pool22
Reviews.Content: Boutique view is a very clean,modern & well situated hotel. It is within walking distance to any where in Amsterdam. It was quiet yet just around the corner from one of the main squares. Natalie the manager was extremely hospitable,nothing was too much bother for her.I would recommend this to anyone, we were a group of 7, but equally I would feel happy with just my partner. Rooms were very clean (a little small but that was a small double!) & one of the best beds I have ever slept on!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BJBrown08
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Amsterdam at 8:30 am. For some reason I did not have the name of my hotel on with my reservation ID#. All offices were closed back in the US for at least 6 hours. I called this hotel to see if I was booked with them & spoke to Nathalie, she confirmed that I did not have res w/them but that I could come & she would help me. I was welcomed given coffee, my luggage was stored safely, & Nathalie started making calls for me. As I waited for an hour I had a chance to chat with some of the quests, all had a wonderful time and would book here again without hesitation. My hotel info was found & off I went. If I had not already had a prepaid booking I would have definitely stayed. I will be forever grateful for Nathalie's warmth & kindness to a stranded female traveling alone & when I come back I will be booking here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable, and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: AndyCollingswood_NJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the first 3 days of our european honeymoon and were very pleased with our time here. We arrived a few hours early and our room was not ready. Natalie, the very friendly girl who checked us in, offered to hold our luggage for us so we could go find some food while they prepare the room for us. When we returned she informed us that we had been upgraded for free. She immediately grabbed 2 of our 3 bags and insisted on showing us to our room (the only hotel to do this out of the 5 we visited). First she showed us the original room we had booked, then the upgraded room and let us choose! We opted for the larger upgraded room, naturally. The room and the hotel in general was clean and the decor was classy. The beds we comfortable and the towels were nice and soft, two important things that can be taken for granted when booking a room. I believe there was free WIFI but we did not bring our laptops. However, we were in luck as there are 2 computers available with internet access. The location was great. A quiet street along the canal. Very close to Liedsplien where there are some resturaunts to choose from, close to some shopping and more fast food type choices (i reccomend wok to walk) and smaller cafes, and close to tram station making it easy to get around the city. Quiet neighborhood, great for sleeping in or those early to bed. The hotel itself was always a peacful environment and the staff was very friendly and helpful with directions and such. I feel the need to mention inparticular our friends Natalie and Puck who greeted us every morning. One morning in particular Natalie took the time to get online and help us plan out a day outside of the city which required taking a tram, an underground train, and a bus, as well as some walking. After researching and finding us a route she printed it all out for us and reviewed it with us making sure we understood the directions. It turned out to be a great day and we found our way just fine thanks to Natalie's help. Last but certainly not least, they do serve a breakfast there in the morning which consists of the usual coffee, tea, juice, meats, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, cereal, croisants and bread. But every morning Natalie offered to cook us something as well and everymorning we took her up on it. Pancakes with cheese and bacon cooked into the pancake! Delicious!!! She did offer other varieties but after trying this one we continued to ask for it every other day! And she was happy to do it for us. Best breakfast of the whole trip! The hotel and surrounding area is nice and met all of our expectations, but the staff surpassed them. They really made us feel like guests and not simply customers. I reccomend staying here highly and if you do, say hello to piccolo and his brother for me :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: D N
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel. Very clean, room size was ample and for how close it was to the main city center, price was excellent. Udo, Nathalie and staff were fantastic and I will definately stay ay this hotel for my future trips to Amsterdam. Dina, Toronto Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: bebob_Isabel
Reviews.Content: We felt really welcome in this hotel! Nathalie and Udo did everything to make out stay as comfortably as possible. All is desingned and furnished with lots of love. And even as the stairs are really narrow - as in usual in typical Amsterdam houses - there is no need for a lift, because the hosts will help you with the luggage! The breakfast was better than in most big hotels, so we were well prefered for stressfull business days! The only thing is that you have a really small bathroom. But therefore the location is great! It is placed in a quiet, small street besides a small town canal and within a few minutes walk you can reach theaters, restaurants, bars and all the nighlife! The hotel is not that cheap, but from my experience the hotels in Amsterdam are expensive and additional it was an exhibition time - so the price was quite ok. We look forward to stay here again next time in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Really great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Miles4BG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a Deluxe Double Room with a canal view while visiting Amsterdam, and were very happy with our stay. The location is fantastic - even with our big bags it was very easy to get to from the airport, and only slightly more difficult to get to the train station on the way out. It's near lots of bars and shops and for most of the trip we just walked everywhere - it's close enough to all the touristy / interesting things to do so. Also I recommend Cafe George nearby for food or drinks - very nice :) Our room was spacious and had a fantastic view over the canal. We even had a balcony that looked out onto the water which was awesome. The people at reception were very helpful for any queries we had, helped us get our bags in and out, and they offer 24 hour room service with a number of reasonably priced snacks that can just go straight onto your room bill. The other (more positive) reviews of this hotel are accurate, including the downsides. There is not much in the way of amenities in the room (no tissues for example), but they do detail what they have on their website, and the free wi-fi is a godsend. And they are very reasonably priced for central Amsterdam so it is understandable. Also take note of the lack of air conditioning - I was glad to know about this before we went, so we could factor it into our decision, but it was fine. Amsterdam is not usually a warm city, and so when our room did get too warm we just opened the window and let the fresh air in (which was lovely anyway). If you're worried about bugs like another TA reviewer, you can leave the light curtain across the window to stop them coming in. Also the staircase is VERY narrow as other people mentioned, and there is no lift, but this is central Amsterdam and is the norm for little places like this! It is something to be aware of if you have a lot of luggage, but not really something to criticise the hotel for. We slept really well while here - while being central it is a quiet street, and we were not woken by any noise during the night. One last thing to note - our bed was actually two singles pushed together. Because we'd seen this in other reviews we knew what to expect, and it was fine! We would definitely come and stay here again if we came back to Amsterdam. It is a clean, comfortable, and welcoming hotel, with a great location and is really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but costly”
Reviews.Author: Isua
Reviews.Content: An impromptu short trip to Amsterdam from London, so decided to try out this hotel. The location is pretty good with proximity to the main tourist areas. Hotel was not difficult to locate. My room was up on the 3rd level. No lift and the staircase is steep and narrow. Quite an adventure just bringing the luggage up the stairs. The hotel staff (Natalie) did offer to help porter the luggage... Room was of good size, with a nice view. There is a hook outside the window that can be used to hoist furniture and bulky items up to the room - somewhat unique for buildings in Amsterdam. Room comes with TV, fan, ensuite toilet/shower. No air-conditioning. I have to comment on the toilet. The flush is way too strong! You get water rushing out from the rim of the toilet bowl when you flush, at least I will like to believe its just water... Free internet only at the basement, no WiFi available. Resident pets are so charming - there is a small dog and a kitten. I find the cost bordering on the pricey side, relative to what I get. But I suppose most other hotels in Amsterdam are expensive. Overall, I will recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, a great find”
Reviews.Author: mv4164
Reviews.Content: I found Boutique Hotel View by reading reviews here on TripAdvisor, and what they say is true. The atmosphere is very welcoming and charming. The hotel has relatively new management and they are obviously eager to please and make guests comfortable. I was pleased with my room, which felt more like walking into my living room at home than a hotel room. My only dislike was that the bathroom was fairly unimpressive. Things were a little hectic at breakfast given that they're short-staffed but I think new management will work that out in due time. Location truly was brilliant for exploring central Amsterdam away from red-light district.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay needs some improving”
Reviews.Author: twinklestar2307
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this "boutique" hotel for 2 nights - On checking-in Natalie was very nice, she gave me an "upgrade" to a small double room, the stairs are very steep and narrow so she carried my case to the top floor. The room smelled of stale smoke but I decided not to complain, strange colour of green decorated the room/bed throw and pillows, small "Juliet" balcony was the best feature of the room. My room overlooked the canal on the corner, Cramped bathroom with shower and curtain so the water slopped everywhere. No tea/coffee making facility but a hair-dryer was available in the bathroom, free standing fan in the room as no air con. I made the mistake of leaving my window open (smell of smoke more than anything) and was bitten extensively by some sort of bug - hence the reason for the fan! Free internet access available in the basement via 2 PCs, no printer. Breakfast was from 8am so I did have it the first morning, normal continental but cooked breakfast was available if you wished. The owners dog and 2 kittens had the run of the place, so if you dont like animals be aware! they were elsewhere during breakfast but on my last morning, I left before breakfast had started, food was out and the kitttens were running round up and over where the food was laid out, one stuck its head in the bowl of "fruit salad"!!!!! A bit of a walk to the Train Station but close to the trams which could take you round Amsterdam. No cafe's/deli's close by, I think you could buy a coffee/soft drink./drink at the reception but I wasnt told this on check-in. It was a nice enough stay, for the money I think I could have had somwhere nicer/more modern, common areas (stairs/landing) could do with a "tart-up" to be honest, Dont think I would rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Remmyf
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel!!!!! We had a small double with a canal view- it was lovely and the best part is the hotel felt welcoming and was clean and in a great location. It was a close to a major tram stop and easy to get to from the airport by bus. The hotel building is charming- although the small double was small ( knowing I was going into that) everyhing is true to their word. I highly recommend!! Natalie and her crew are the best!!! A sure boutique it is.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Irene2011922
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Boutique Hotel View and we were really happy with our choice. The Hotel is very close to the centre, the room was small but really nice, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good and the selfmade pancakes were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but book the right room”
Reviews.Author: 5ali
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy to get to from bus/tram. Left bags, Natalie very friendly and helpful. Came back a lot later in the afternoon and room not ready. Despite having paid for a superior room with a view through expedia, we were in the basement which was very dismal with a very outdated bathroom. On complaining, we were offered a free breakfast, which we felt was a good way of resolving the issue, however it took the shine off our trip. Expensive for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect breakfast to get your day started”
Reviews.Author: vincentdas
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere in the Boutique View Hotel is very relaxed, you come down to have breakfast and the owners will prepare you pancakes or eggs in the open kitchen. You have a lot of choice for the rest of the breakfast as well. The owners will have a nice chat with you and are the best guides of the city, so if you need some tips, just ask them! A perfect breakfast to get your day started!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant old hotel, very small room but fine as you don't need to spend too much time in it!”
Reviews.Author: Fluffy108
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming owner and small room but a lovely view over the canal. We only used the hotel for sleeping and showering ready to go out again over a weekend. Never sampled the breakfasts but the dining room looked very pleasant and the hotel had some very sweet kittens! The steep staircase and small room were charming, as it's a lovely old building. Very near to the Rijk museum and the centre of town and lovely and quiet at night with great blackout curtains so we slept very well indeed. Older travellers might consider the staircase before booking, that's all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely manager, delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Esther_83Perth
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. On arrival, we were welcomed and given a small upgrade to a room with a canal view, which was lovely. The rooms were clean, and the bed was comfortable. The location was great, very close to everything and easy access to public transport, including the bus to the airport (4 euros pp.). What really makes this hotel worth a stay is the friendly manager, Nathalie. She was very helpful and also made the most delicious breakfast - bacon and cheese scrambled eggs and pancakes, made to order! It is not very often you come across a manager who takes such an interest in her customers, or who offers such personalised service with a smile. It was really nice :) Also, the coffee from the machine was great too (Try the mocchachino!). Oh, and the free internet access (an actual computer, not just free wi-fi), which was also a rare find on our 6 weeks travelling Europe. My only dislike was the steep and narrow staircase, which being on the third floor was particularly annoying with heavy suitcases. However, Nathalie assisted us with our luggage which was great, and you can't really help that considering it is a traditional building on the canal. We would stay here again without hesitation :)

Reviews.Title: “It was a very familiar atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Corinna H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated very nearby the city centre but it is very calm. The service is very good and you may experience a very familiar, calm and relaxing atmosphere. The breakfast is very good. We loved it and when we come back to Amsterdam we would book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller room is tiny and smells moldy”
Reviews.Author: PnPnT
Reviews.Content: Great position for a hotel, friendly service, however, beware the smaller room(s).....We booked 2 double rooms for our stay. One was 20 Euro less and we were told, slightly smaller but that was all that was available, so we accepted two different sized rooms. The difference in size , about 4 x, shocked us. We did not feel the slightly cheaper price reflected the extreemly squashed conditions we had to endure, and to make things worse, being woken up at night by the moldy smells from the tiny bathroom didn't help. When we enquired about moving to a bigger room, we were told that would only be possible for 1 of the 3 nights, so it could not be done........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katrina H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 4 year old son. Natalie who runs the hotel with her brother, is extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was a great size and on the first floor, so not too many steps to walk up with a young child. The room had a lovely contemporary feel, and the both the bed and pillows were very comfortable. I'm fussy about pillows, so it was great to have one that wasn't too hard or too soft! The breakfast was delightful, and Natalie cooks herself while having a chat if things aren't too busy. I recommend her bacon and cheese pancakes. Brilliant location for setting off on your bikes or by foot-just around the corner from the Leidersplan, with it's restaurants and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Discovery”
Reviews.Author: Allison48
Reviews.Content: My sister, daughter and I very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was excellent for enjoying picturesque Amsterdam's Museum Quarter and Vondelpark, and within walking distance of many other tourist attractions. Our room was well appointed, clean and quiet - and the free WiFi was so convenient ! This hotel serves an excellent breakfast, a very good start to your touristing day. Best of all, personnel at the hotel were always friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to make you feel at home. I definitely would re-book here next time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely elegant and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: eliz_h_green
Reviews.Content: Hotel Boutique View was very welcoming - it had a pleasant ambience in all areas, and the young proprietors were friendly, warm, and helpful. The room was small but light and cheerful, with a spectacular view of a canal with trees and houseboats. The hotel was clean and carefully kept, with small thoughtful touches making us feel welcome The breakfast was elegant and plentiful, and we were cooked eggs personally by the proprietor. The character of the original house has been preserved pleasantly.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkG59
Reviews.Content: hotel was best have stayed in while in Amsterdam, nice big rooms full of character and charm, rooms are also clean and beds are comfy, although this hotel is non smoking they said we could use the yard and they made every effort to make us comfy, I will defo return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Like at home.. but better!”
Reviews.Author: mattiadg
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel View by chance, since we had a reservation in a (terrible..) hotel just around the corner of this magnificent boutique hotel. We entered suspiciously to give it a look and met one of the owners (two very nice and friendly Amsterdammers). It was love at first sight! We had a nice green room with a wonderful view on the famous canals. Breakfast was delicious and cooked in front of you by the owner, in the cosy lounge which is organized as a dining room with american kitchen. Hotel view has everything that you need on holiday: it is quiet and clean, it is perfectly placed in the canals zone, it has free internet connection in the rooms, just to mention some of the amenities we found there! And by the way, the value for money is great!

Reviews.Title: “A great little spot”
Reviews.Author: Moira2011
Reviews.Content: My sister, niece and I stayed at the Hotel Boutique View and had a great experience. The owners, who are relatively new to the place, were very friendly, helpful and wonderful to deal with. The hotel was clean, comfortable and a very convenient location for museums, canal cruises and sightseeing downtown. The breakfast was amazing and the service just great. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, hated to leave.”
Reviews.Author: WUD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. Natalie and her brother and mother were so nice, helpful and accommodating. Natalie made me the best pancake every morning, i miss them even now. We highly recommend staying here when in Amsterdam, the location is wonderful, so close to everything. We felt like we were in a great home environment. Hope to go back one day, Francis and Bill Donald from Little Rock, AR USA

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic and expensive”
Reviews.Author: trotamundosj
Reviews.Content: I don't know how are the other rooms but ours, was claustrophobic... we chose the cheap room (130â‚¬ per night!!!!), and we barely had space for the luggage. But the worse thing was that the shower was together with the toilet, so if you had a shower everything was wet and you cannot do anything else... I do not know how are the other rooms, but having seen this one, I would never recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Back again...and better than ever!”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamSmudgers
Reviews.Content: Having been here before we knew what to expect...at least we thought we did. However Udo and Natalie (not forgetting Mum) went to extraordinary lengths to make this stay extra special! We arrived for a surprise birthday celebration and opened our bedroom door to find a room full of balloons - it looked fantastic! We then enjoyed a lovely glass of wine...very welcome after our long journey. Since our last visit in January the hotel has had a new kitchen and breakfast bar installed. Breakfast was delicious...a selection of cold meats, fresh fruit, cereals, croissants, breads and home cooked pancakes with bacon...yum! Another wonderful stay with very special hosts...can't wait for the next one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SpencerDavey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a 3 month extended travel session with my fiance. Aged 30 and 29 respectively, we no longer wanted to stay in a hostel, yet did not want to spend fortunes on accommodation. This place was great value for money for what you got. The location was perfect for us. Central, yet on a quiet street away from the loud and busy streets. The service was attentive and friendly. The manager (which I think was also the owner as she asked us our opinion on some bath room re-fits she was about to undertake) insisted on carrying our luggage upstairs. The breakfast was amazing (home cooked meal of bacon and eggs). The room itself was quite small from an Australian point of view, but it was more than adequate for European standards. If you travel to Europe, then you need to expect rooms to be slightly smaller than what you're accustomed to in Australia, or regional America. No air-conditioning in the room, but provided with a fan, luckily it was cooler than expected in July. The bed was very comfortable. From a cleanliness point of view I couldn't fault the place. Very clean. One thing that bothered us a bit was that we were on the 3rd floor and the stairs were very steep. However, again this is a characteristic of all buildings in Amsterdam, so if you are not able bodied then I'd recommend a 1st floor request. The hotel also had a very cute dog, and newly appointed kittens as residence in the common area, and my fiance loved this! All-in-all, a great hotel, and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed our stay,it was great..”
Reviews.Author: sasha72uk
Reviews.Content: Soon as you get in the hotel you will be surprised that is only rated as a 2 star hotel, rooms, food everything was nice and is very close to all you need to see in Amsterdam, tram is very close by and so is the bus which takes you direct to the airport.Our daughter loved it we got room with the pink covers and it was immaculate. Very clean and very quiet, even though our room looked at the canal I haven't had trouble falling asleep.It is safe which was my main concern when I booked it and faraway from red district where we didn't even bother to go to.I would recommend this hotel to everyone just I think not for older people because of the very steep stairs in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable stay and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: KPKPMK
Reviews.Content: My friends and I chose this hotel and we could not have been happier! It was a wonderful location and the staff were not only friendly but very helpful. :) I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and plan on staying again if I make it back to Amsterdam. :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: lucalondon85
Reviews.Content: We went there for a short break from the 09 july till the 11th. Considering the city we were a bit worried about the quality of the hotels, we were very surprised to see that actually the pictures were matching exactly what you would see in person! The room was compact (for a short break it's absolutely fine) but beautifully set and with a very good bathroom. The bed was super comfy and we had a beautiful canal-side view! Always very clean and with an inviting smell at breakfast. The deal is the you have the service of an hotel but the welcoming of a family! It's not a two star hotel beside the fact it has no lift! The owner and "mama" are super-cool people, we'll definitely go back there once in Amsterdam again!!! Luca&Valentina

Reviews.Title: “Such wonderful management!”
Reviews.Author: califf22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a Europe trip - we started in Italy (Rome-Florence-Naples-Capri), and we planned to head to Amsterdam on the ultimate American holiday: July 4th. With travel comes unexpected twists, and we experienced just that when my husband's wallet (w/ passport, traveler's checks, a memory card, credit cards, ID and $300 euro) was stolen on the train in Rome. It happened on a Sunday, which meant that the US Embassy was closed. Unfortunately, the following day was the 4th of July, the United States' Independence Day = US Embassy was closed. We were scheduled to fly out of Rome to Amsterdam at 6:20am on July 4th. We were unable to travel without my husband's passport, and we had to miss our Amsterdam trip completely. Although Italy was amazing - beautiful culture, great food, amazing sites - we were looking forward to Amsterdam the most. This brings me to my review of Boutique Hotel View.
