What first struck us about this hotel is the aesthetics - the building itself, rooms, lobby are adorable! Beyond that, their website is professional and their prices are just right. I emailed Boutique Hotel View, explaining that we will be a no-show in Amsterdam. I lamented about our experience, and to my surprise, the General Manager reimbursed us for our stay. This literally brought tears to my eyes since my husband and I lost about $1500 in this experience. After going through the authorities in Italy - feeling (unfortunately) helpless - it is so refreshing to come across someone that has compassion. My husband and I do plan to travel to Amsterdam in the coming years, and we plan to stay with Boutique Hotel View. Any hotel or General Manager of a hotel that exhibits such humanity and kindness, I will rant and rave! I do hope you take my review into account and book your time with Boutique Hotel View!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luluf4u
Reviews.Content: Small room but very clean and modern. Only disadvantage was that we were on the fourth floor - very tiny steep staircase which was difficult for hauling up luggage.

Reviews.Title: “If your not on the tightest of budgets, a would recommend Boutique Hotel View”
Reviews.Author: Siirinen
Reviews.Content: A great locations for those who don't mind taking the tram and enjoy a good nice sleep. Very quiet but only a minute walk to a busy restaurant area. And with the tram but 10 minutes from the center or museum areas. Very friendly staff and good breakfast: for 10 e all-you-can-eat coffee, tea and juices, bread, croissants and rolls with cheese or meat, yoghurt and fruits and they make your eggs just as you like them.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it. Great location-hope to visit again.”
Reviews.Author: kvanderdussen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights-a Monday through a Friday and had a great stay. Our 13 year old son was with us so we had a triple room-large by European standards and comfortable. The beds were soft and it was quiet at night-hard to come by in Amsterdam. The owners were friendly and very helpful. It was unseasonably warm-hot and humid for a couple of days, but there was a fan in the bedroom which helped us with comfort at night. Steep stairs-which is also not unusual for a canal row house. Very close to tram stop and the Rikjsmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A bit less then expected”
Reviews.Author: Our_Thoughts_Sydney
Reviews.Content: Whilst the service is very friendly and the location is great we didn't totally love it. What let us down is the fact the the double beds are simple two singles put together (and even made separately). Also we didn't necessarily feel it was great value for money. However the staff are incredibly friendly, helpful and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “very recommended !!!”
Reviews.Author: haimheled
Reviews.Content: What do you need more from a room ? most importantly it is clean, located in the best location you can ask for (near Leidseplain square) but still in a quiet corner, very friendly staff (Natalie and her brother). One advice though, if you having trouble climbing stairs ask for a first floor room... for me personally it is not an issue. We stayed at the small double room on the third floor, Best value for the money !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: FlactemK
Reviews.Content: The small double room is very small, if you want space to walk around the bed, it isn't for you. The room was pleasant and had a good view over the canal, but was very compact. The bathroom is a wet room style shower/toilet/sink with just a curtain between the toilet and shower. The bed was extremely soft and felt like sleeping on a cloud - we dropped straight off every night. The regional custom of two single duvets for a double bed is followed, which is a bit strange if you're not used to it, but we managed. Breakfast was good, if not hugely varied, and was served by a very friendly chatty lady who cooks behind reception at the same time as she checks people out and serves tables. Quite impressive really.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and friendly owners”
Reviews.Author: luc123
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and usually I take upscale hotels. This time I knew I was going to arrive late and leave early, so I just wanted to have a decent bed at an affordable price (which is in Amsterdam often a challenge). I was welcomed in a personal way, and was in my room 5 minutes after I arrived. The room was fine, light and fresh, and there was easy internet access. In the morning I took the breakfast which comes only for 10 euro (versus many other hotels 20-25 euro), and it was really a nice breakfast. Everything fresh, and the eggs were made made by the owner of the hotel. Parking space that fitted my (big) SUV was in 5 minutes walk, also important. Thanks for the personal attention during the short stay !

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Agree with other Reviews”
Reviews.Author: JWKatz22
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is in a fantastic location (close to museums, historic sites, city center), we found the rooms Tiny (even for European standards) and a bit unclean. The bathroom had a strange odor, and was more of a shower room - no defined shower, so the toilet was in the 'shower stall'. We booked this hotel due to all the positive reviews, and we were disappointed. The staff is very friendly, though (although they gave us incorrect instructions about the bus to the airport), and the breakfasts are tasty and made to order (though they do not come with the room).

Reviews.Title: “best value for your money”
Reviews.Author: obi2knobbe
Reviews.Content: The hotel was surprisingly lovely for a small boutique hotel. New management since January 2011, the service was superb! Wonderful management staff, Natalie and her brother! They were very friendly. I got there too early for check-in, around 9:30 (12:00 noon was the check in time). Natalie offered me coffee or tea and asked if I wanted to freshen up before my tour which was for 12:30 p.m. She opened the ground floor room for me to use and gave me directions and a map and tour brochure. When I came back from the tour around 7:30 pm, Natalie's brother helped me bring up with my luggage to my room, which was wonderfully clean, although small. the bathroom was very clean, and everything was new. the linens were all new and even the bed was new. I had the garden view and it was surprisingly VERY QUITE. I did not have to wear earplugs at night. Natalie advised me to take the bus to airport, which was only a 20 minute ride and cheap! 4.00 euros only as opposed to taking a cab and paying 40.00 euros. She saved me a ton of money, which i used to buy souveniers at the airport. Greatest value for your money!! Will definitely recommend to all my friends and family!!!

Reviews.Title: “Request first floor!”
Reviews.Author: MargaretVirginia_USA
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, well-maintained property in a good location. Breakfast is available for an extra fee. Our room was clean and well maintained. Service was very good and, like everyone else we met in Amsterdam the owners spoke great English and were friendly and helpful. It was one of the few hotels around that offered accommodation for 3 people in a room (we were traveling with our teenage son). The only drawback was the location of the room. We were on the fourth floor (third floor of rooms) and there is no elevator. Like probably most old Amsterdam canal houses, the steps are very steep and they curve around, so it's an effort to go up them and can be treacherous to go down. I wish we had waited for a first floor room to be cleaned--it was offered to us but we didn't understand at the time how much difference this would have made to the enjoyment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: silver1982
Reviews.Content: I never usually write reviews but this hotel is worth mentioning. I was surprised to find this hotell to be so atmospheric, comfortable and delicate. The location is superb, close to a quiet part of a canal. And the staff is welcoming and relaxing. Ive never felt this at home in a hotel after just one day of visiting. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “More than value for money”
Reviews.Author: caprccio96
Reviews.Content: Perfect familyhotel with warmness and atmosfire + excellent view just in the hard of the city. Tastefull indoor decoration which we havve been enjoyed a lot. Big rooms even for big boys.

Reviews.Title: “Every time I'm in Amsterdam I go back”
Reviews.Author: rivermusic24
Reviews.Content: Every time I pass through Amsterdam I go back. It's quiet but close to the buzz of the city and the canal (outside the windows of the rooms on the front) creates a sense of peace - it was snowing last time I was there - all very fairy-tale. Udo & the team care about the hotel & about you and it makes them happy to see you happy! Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY WITH EXCELLENT POSITION”
Reviews.Author: EleErmanno
Reviews.Content: Boutique Hotel View is a very nice hotel in the best position of the town, near Leidse Plein (sure, it's better than DAM place) there are many restaurants and bar, there is a great nightlife and all town is accessible from there because by feet, also if hotel is one minute far from tram lines and near to bus station to go to the airport (in few minutes and less cost than train!). The hotel is very clean (italian people are demanding!), rooms are small because hotel is in an ancient building on three floors without lift, but all is perfect and fantastic! Sure I and my boyfriend we''ll come back there....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Annie1130
Reviews.Content: Upon reading other great reviews, we decided to book this hotel for our 2 night stay in Amsterdam. We were not disappointed! After a bad experience from unfriendly Parisians, Amsterdam was a definitely a refreshing change (with the exception of Maurya Indian Restaurant - Don't go there!) Although we arrived 2 hours early, management was kind enough to let us check in and offered us refreshments as we waited for housekeeping to finish. They also helped carry my 50lbs worth of luggage up 2 flights of narrow stairs, free of charge, there was no way I would've made it up there by myself lol.. Room- We took other reviewer's advice and for a little more, booked a deluxe canal view double room. Decorated in pink (my fave!) and brown, it was such a cute and spacious room! The view was gorgeous, that and on top of the hospitality made this hotel extremely romantic and cozy. The room was very clean. The sheets and towels were all fresh. The bathroom was simple. Although the bed was a little dusty but a lot of buildings in Amsterdam are older and the opportunity to stay in the cute Dutch buildings is an experience by itself. Overall, the room was very comfortable to stay in. Like another reviewer said, the service was first class! The owner, Natalie (?), made us feel right at home, but we still had our privacy. Breakfast is served until 11am in the morning, for late-risers like us, it was really nice to be able to roll out of bed and walk down the stairs for made-to-order scrambled eggs! For 10euros, you get eggs of your choice, baguettes, toast, an assorted variety of fruit, cheese, sliced meat, coffee, juice, milk, and yogurt. The hotel is in a great location, you can literally walk everywhere and yes to the Red Light District or just hop on a tram right outside the hotel. (I would NOT wear heels though, the cobblestones will destroy your poor feet.) Overall, the hotel is safe, clean, romantic, great canal view, centrally located, good genuine service, decently priced, and just overall pretty awesome. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, typical Dutch style architecture, clean & friendly!”
Reviews.Author: TravShaz
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as not many apartments are available. I wanted something clean, close to the town centre, but not on a main road with too much noise. The staff were extremely friendly & wished my husband a Happy Birthday (I requested a room with a view for a birthday surprise). Negatives: 3 flights of very steep stairs to get to our room. We are reasonably fit, so not a problem for us, but if you have an injury or are unfit, request the 1st floor only. The top floor can get very hot (not sure about the others). Windows can open & this relieves the problem, but if facing the street you need to close them at night due to street noise - so bit of a catch 22. Breakfast was good & cooked for you by request as well as continental options available (breakfast costs extra). Oh, the beds are 2 singles pushed together, but they were pretty comfy & once your eyes are closed you don't know the difference Overall, happy

Reviews.Title: “Started weird, but ended well... a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jolliette
Reviews.Content: So I looked literally for weeks to try and find a small, reasonably priced place on the canal in Amsterdam. In the end, I finally decided on Boutique Hotel View. I chose it because of the reviews and proximity to Leidseplein and various tram connections. To be honest, we experienced one of the strangest moments out of all our travels during check in. Upon arrival, we noticed this sketchy guy lingering outside the hotel. We went inside, and he followed and he went to his room. When the hotel cleaner came down, they were complaining there was blood and weed all over the hotel room and the strange guest was to leave immediately. There was a small altercation since the guest seemed pretty wasted and agressive but he eventually left. The hotel staff apologized for the noise and repeatedly asked if they could do anything for us while we waited. They helped us get our things to our room after the strange guest had left and gave instructions on internet usage etc. Please don't form a bad impression of this hotel because of our experience. I am including it to show the hotel staff handled it perfectly by always were asking if we were OK. We did not not once feel as if we were in danger. Some people travel to Amsterdam thinking they can smoke weed, drink anywhere and do whatever they want. Because the hotel would not tolerate such behaviour and obvious use of drugs speaks volumes about the type of establishment they run. The hotel is sweet on the outside, very much what anyone would expect in Amsterdam. It's right on the canal and the lobby/breakfast/check in area is quite lovely, albeit small. Our room was small, I mean really tiny. I've travelled all over the world including many places in Europe but this is the smallest ever. The decor was brown and bright pink, but I liked it. There was a double bed, a small desk and a closet for hanging clothes. There was also a place to put your suitcase. With all this laid out, there really was no walking around space. The wall opposite the bed was literally 2 feet away. Although small, we did not mind it and managed to settle in. The bathroom was ok, just a walk-in shower with a curtain and the floor tended to get wet while showering. There was free wifi, which was great and appreciated. Hotel location was excellent, right on the canal with a nice view. There was some construction going on in the area while there and the noise was tolerable. It was unfortunate to see a portable toilet on the road every time you looked out the window but not the end of the world. Hotel was a 3 min walk to Leidseplein square with many restaurants, shopping and bars. The tram connections are amazing from Leidseplein and you can pretty much get anywhere from there. I would recommend getting a tram pass to cover the amount of days you're in Amsterdam. The tram personnel monitor whether you are passing your cards when entering and exiting the tram and will confront you if they don't see you swipe accordingly. We got the tram everywhere and adored the hotel location for this very reason. Breakfast was great and tailored to the small amount of people staying in the hotel. It was not a massive spread but there was always enough each time we went downstairs. The view over the canal while eating was lovely. Breakfast included fresh croissants, breads, meat, cheese, yogurt, fruits and cereal. It's unfortunate the breakfast is 10 euro extra but we didn't mind paying and appreciated the convenience. In the end we only had to pay for 2 mornings of breakfast. The hotel covered the rest given our strange check in experience. We appreciated this very much; a nice gesture on their side. Hotel stairs are steep so keep this in mind if you have mobility issues or large suitcases. The staff will help you however. The stairs are quite typical of Amsterdam homes and I liked them. It really is a nice hotel and I'm glad to see it getting more reviews, and good ones at that. I forget his name, but the front desk guy was great in chatting with us, offering us suggestions on where to eat and answering our questions on Dutch way of life. Give this place a try. It's local, small, convenient and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a nice spot but not a great sleep”
Reviews.Author: tom_oz11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a top spot, walking distance to key areas. Rooms are well laid out and have all requisite amenities. The central stair case is very noisy as it squeaks very loudly so you hear everyone get home or leave of a morning. There was also early morning construction going on (in fact drills etc were left in the walkways to be stepped over with luggage. I mention this casually to the front desk when I checked out and was surprised to be told that I was wrong and I wasnt noisy - guess it was in my head... I will not return

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, centrally placed hotel with very helpful owners.”
Reviews.Author: JMJ21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at your lovely hotel for 4 nights with my husband Rob from 26/03/2011. We had a great time - the hotel was comfortable and Natalie your breakfasts were fantastic, especially the eggs cooked to order. The room we stayed in was spacious and quiet. The hotel was perfectly situated and we could almost walk to everywhere we wanted. Thank you for being so helpful. Hope your new kitchen is taking shape. We will come back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: fae51
Reviews.Content: We arrived and we were greeted with a very friendly smile and warm welcome by the owner. Made to feel at home immediately! Very modern, cosmo feel nothing was to much! Great location and would definatley recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great position but small room at the third floor without lift”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned, close to Leidseplein and the night-life. We didn't use tram; we took the bus only to go to the airport (and the bus stop is near to the hotel too). The room was little but comfortable and the receptionist was very kind and helpful with us. We recommend it for a few days stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tillyminto
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - just returned from my second visit there and will stay there again on my next trip to Amsterdam. It is in an excellent central location and yet isn't noisy. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the breakfast is good. Very clean. Lovely cozy, comfy beds. I would advise to book a delux room though as the standard rooms are on the small side and can get a little claustraphobic. The rooms with canal view are particularly nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adam1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights over Valentines and had a wonderful time,great location and the room was also very good but the service from the hotel really was 1st class,when we returned home i discovered that i had left a t-shirt in my room,i emailed the hotel and they said they would return my t-shirt & pay for the postage! So overall a great hotel,with a great breakfast at a great price!!! Would definetely recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top location and fab room!”
Reviews.Author: SanGrya
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is situated in a quiet area but right on the doorstep of the hustle and bustle. We loved it! We had a luxury double with a 'garden view', but this was mainly brick wall so book a canal view if you want a pleasant vista. The room was stylish with really comfy beds, and the service was fab. And no there isn't a bar but there's a counter full of all sorts of drinks you can buy anytime. This is a 2* B&B so know what you're booking! Breakfast is okay but you can buy nicer elsewhere. All in all a fab stay though and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: doctorsmudge8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days in Amsterdam with my beloved. You'd be hard pressed to find a better located place to stay, smack in the middle of everything. So easy to get there from Centraal Station, which in turn is so easy to get to from the airport. Situated about 100m from the main square at Leidseplein which has so much going on at any hour, on any day of the year. In easy walking distance from The Dam square and all major attractions, theatres, bars, eateries and the wonderfully intimate jazz club, Alto. The hotel is in a typical Dutch canal side building which means narrow and tall. The hotel has just been completely refurbished to very high standard. As pointed out in other reviews the stairs are akin to scaling the North Face of the Eiger. Clamp-ons optional. The room we had, 101, was clean, tidy, well made up every day, modern fitments but, and a big but, very cramped. We had a glimpse into the next door room, 102 and it was quite vast, so I'd suggest you check when you book as to what you are getting. We were invited to a party in the hotel the first night we arrived and were greeted as friends and shown the utmost hospitality by the owners. On the subject of which the owner/manager was the most incredibly helpful, generous and kind person. I cant think how she could of done any more to make the stay better. I would of been quite happy to mark this as 5 for all aspects but the size of this particular room (101) was a let down, as was the view of every-ones back yard. The rooms facing the front are right on the canal front so you'll have a great view, maybe a better view would of made up for our small room? All in all, its a great place in a great location in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: fhann1
Reviews.Content: This lovely B&B is well situated for all areas of the city. We hired bikes for 2 days from Mac Bikes and spent all day, each day buzzing around from one site to another. The hotel was well presented and looked like it had been recently renovated. The beds were so cosy we didn't want to get up in the morning ! The staff were really polite and helpful. Hotel were happy to print off my boarding card before leaving on Monday morning which was great as it saved queing and paying at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: herefordapple
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay in the Boutique Hotel, Amsterdam. Would definitely recommend it. We stayed for our wedding anniversary and had a great time, lovely room, brilliant location. Breakfast was very nice and the staff were incredibly helpful, going to incredible lengths to help us resolve a difficulty that cropped us for us whilst we were there that had nothing to do with the hotel. The location is great, walking distance from good museums and lots of nice restaurants and bars - we will definitely be goin back

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Saippa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near Leidseplein but still quite quiet. I have only two negative things to say. The carpet was a bit stained. There were no minibar at the room. We climbed to the third floor and right back to downstairs to get some water.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: a_klein13
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in a walking distance from Museumplein, in an entertaining area, near the main shopping district. The public transport in Amsterdam is absolutely amazing and the tram/bus stop is 2min walk from the hotel. Journey from the Central Station takes around 10 min-there is direct connection with lines 1, 2 and 5. The hotel itself seems to be new and is very nicely decorated. Staff is well-mannered and helpful. We had our room in the basement which may sound scary but apeared to be pleasant and comfortable. On thing I did not liked was the bathroom without shower cabin (i mean there was a shower but separated only with a curtain so the floor was constantly wet) and with no hair dryer or shelf to put your stuff on. Anyway, I never slept in such a comfortable bed in european hotel costing less than 200$ per night. I would strongly reccomend this hotel- is hard to find as clean and pleasant place in Amsterdam as Boutique View. Oh yes, guest can use two computers with free high-speed internet connection!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Friendly helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JCSLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Hotel & rooms very clean, breakfast good, staff very helpful and great location.... couldnt really ask for more. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJetSet
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. We were very genuinely offered an upgrade for the first night but declined to take it, in case I had room envy when we were moved. We were given a small double room with a canal view, which was lovely. Tiny room but considering there is a city out there to see you're very rarely in there. Great shower and all the amenities you need. The breakfast was excellent value for a special deal of â‚¬8, with good choice and even some hot dishes (which I did not try but they looked okay). The only thing the breakfast lacked was a toaster, but that's cool, I can survive on cereal and freshly baked croissants. You can smell the croissants getting baked in the morning and it does put you in the mood. Was also very clean and modern. The cats were nice little animals and no bother at all. My favourite feature was the cold beers on room service. I'm sorry I did not try the internet stations but the wifi in the rooms worked perfectly on the iphone.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & great location”
Reviews.Author: RuneViking
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and nice rooms. Unfortunately, the hotel had a couple of cats, which cut our stay short due to my allergic wife. But I would love to come back another time (with another wife).

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGold
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend had a nice stay at this hotel. In general we were very satisfied with our stay. The room we had was very small but we did not stay there a lot so it was not a problem for us. The breakfast was fine and the location is great right next to the Leidseplein. The hotel is generally very clean although we found it a bit unappetizing that the hotel's two kitttens were playing around in the breakfast area and sometimes on the plates.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Georgie83
Reviews.Content: This is still a new hotel and it was a great stay. Rooms are very nice with canal views in the front. The staff were brilliant, really helpful and friendly. Perfect location for centre, bars and food. Well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location, Friendly People”
Reviews.Author: Dancinbird_9
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself have just returned from a Bank Holiday trip to Amsterdam. Whilst not wanting to be too far away from nightlife, restaurants and travel routes we were struggling to find somewhere that had all this but was fairly quiet, away from stag/hen parties and just not so 'in your face' as the area around Dam Square and also value for money with breakfast included, didn't want much did we!!!. I had trawled the internet for around 3 days trying to find somewhere when by accident I came across this hotel. We were very pleasantly surprised, a bus goes straight from Schipol Airport to the top of road the hotel is in, 5 minutes walk and you're there, it's right on the canal and we got a free upgrade to a canal view room, the double room we had was small but it had en-suite was very well decorated, very clean and the bed looked straight over the canal, beautiful to wake up to. It's right on the major tram routes and only 10 minutes to Dam Square. There were plenty of bars, restaurants and shops 5 mins walk away around the Leidersplein. And last but not least the young man who checked us in couldn't have been more helpful and recommended a great night club for our first night out!! We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DRBKLYN
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled all over Europe and had originally booked a hostel in Amsterdam. We were not fond of it when we got there so we only stayed one night and then found this beautiful hotel. We had a beautiful room with two huge windows on the first floor looking out onto a canal. The view was to die for. The stairs are really steep and we needed to have guys from the hotel bring our luggage up, but they had no problems with it and were very accommodating. The only thing that bothered me about Europe and the hotels is that there are no screens on the windows. Two huge windows left open because it was hot can attract a lot of bugs. Especially by water. This was just a minor inconvenience, but it did bother us. Other than that, we loved our stay and were happy we switched to the Boutique Hotel View.
